title: thebloodmaster
author: thebloodmaster
content: What happened::  y i used https://esportsbet.io/ for 1 week wanted to withdrawal then they let me wait 3 days to tell me this per mail https://gyazo.com/6ed18afee7ce40a5c3de4c3a4a2fba0d  stay away from this site thorin montecristo ls all scammer im sad as hell another site that uses imesports provider that let me wait see my btc365 thread hereScammers Profile Link:   not here i think ? Reference Link: Amount Scammed:  1700$Payment Method:  usdtProof of Payment:  sportsbookPM/Chat Logs:  https://gyazo.com/6ed18afee7ce40a5c3de4c3a4a2fba0d Additional Notes:   blocked from discord etc

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: If they don't have a profile here or any announcement thread, there's nothing much you can do having a scam accusation though sharing this with the community will help them avoid the casino.Did you really try to do what they claim against you? Please be honest. If what they is true, you are not following their rules and it makes sense now.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Wasn't the esportsbet.io domain once part of the "Sportsbet.io" brand? I'm not sure if that's still the case.Steve from @sportsbet.io might know more about that.Quote from: sportsbet.io on April 10, 2020, 04:05:35 PMSteve, Sportsbet.ioesportsbet.io

comments.author: morvillz7z
comments.body: Quote from: FatFork on September 27, 2022, 12:01:56 PMWasn't the esportsbet.io domain once part of the "Sportsbet.io" brand? I'm not sure if that's still the case.Steve from @sportsbet.io might know more about that.Quote from: sportsbet.io on April 10, 2020, 04:05:35 PMSteve, Sportsbet.ioesportsbet.ioI don't think esportsbet.io is related in any shape or form to sportsbet.io, and never has been.The quote you got from Steve is from 2020 amidst the start of the pandemic where the only thing you could bet was esports, hence the "sarcastic" undertone of adding esportsbet.io at the end of the message.A quick search on google shows that esportsbet.io was somewhat recently rebranded from djesports.io (never heard of those guys before).https://www.gamblingnews.com/news/dj-esports-rebrands-as-esportsbet-io-with-clear-focus-on-future/

comments.author: thebloodmaster
comments.body: Quote from: Little Mouse on September 26, 2022, 05:51:46 PMIf they don't have a profile here or any announcement thread, there's nothing much you can do having a scam accusation though sharing this with the community will help them avoid the casino.Did you really try to do what they claim against you? Please be honest. If what they is true, you are not following their rules and it makes sense now.nope i didnt thats the sad part if i would have i wouldnt claim the scam on here i dont even know what matxh assisted betting is i just had the refresh the site often cuz it bugged often and im quite active in live betting so i used it really often

comments.author: thebloodmaster
comments.body: Quote from: morvillz7z on September 27, 2022, 01:54:05 PMQuote from: FatFork on September 27, 2022, 12:01:56 PMWasn't the esportsbet.io domain once part of the "Sportsbet.io" brand? I'm not sure if that's still the case.Steve from @sportsbet.io might know more about that.Quote from: sportsbet.io on April 10, 2020, 04:05:35 PMSteve, Sportsbet.ioesportsbet.ioI don't think esportsbet.io is related in any shape or form to sportsbet.io, and never has been.The quote you got from Steve is from 2020 amidst the start of the pandemic where the only thing you could bet was esports, hence the "sarcastic" undertone of adding esportsbet.io at the end of the message.A quick search on google shows that esportsbet.io was somewhat recently rebranded from djesports.io (never heard of those guys before).https://www.gamblingnews.com/news/dj-esports-rebrands-as-esportsbet-io-with-clear-focus-on-future/indeed they not affiliated in any form in the end their is always a chance someone who is maybe close to the site is here in bitcointalk its a crypto bet site afterall someone know what i can do now cuz i really didnt do anything wrong

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: Quote from: thebloodmaster on September 27, 2022, 02:06:08 PMnope i didnt thats the sad part if i would have i wouldnt claim the scam on here i dont even know what matxh assisted betting is i just had the refresh the site often cuz it bugged often and im quite active in live betting so i used it really oftenI think that's what trigger their system and flagging your account, a normal user wouldn't refresh the site every time isn't? it must be a software or automatic tool. Have you try to communicate with their representative first? I think it's only your way in order to solve this problem.Judging from their UI/UX, I don't think their sites are buggy or slow, it must be from your internet or your device. However I never play in this sportsbook, I might be wrong too.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: morvillz7z on September 27, 2022, 01:54:05 PMQuote from: FatFork on September 27, 2022, 12:01:56 PMWasn't the esportsbet.io domain once part of the "Sportsbet.io" brand? I'm not sure if that's still the case.Steve from @sportsbet.io might know more about that.Quote from: sportsbet.io on April 10, 2020, 04:05:35 PMSteve, Sportsbet.ioesportsbet.ioI don't think esportsbet.io is related in any shape or form to sportsbet.io, and never has been.The quote you got from Steve is from 2020 amidst the start of the pandemic where the only thing you could bet was esports, hence the "sarcastic" undertone of adding esportsbet.io at the end of the message.Yes, you're right. I think that post from Steve was probably just a typo and it looks as though esportsbet.io has nothing to do with Sportsbet.io.After further investigation, I found that there is actually an e-sportsbet.io domain that Steve also used at the end of his posts that redirects to their main sportsbet.io domain.

comments.author: thebloodmaster
comments.body: if somebody knows how i can get help in this case it would be appreciated

comments.author: sportsbet.io
comments.body: Quote from: morvillz7z on September 27, 2022, 01:54:05 PMQuote from: FatFork on September 27, 2022, 12:01:56 PMWasn't the esportsbet.io domain once part of the "Sportsbet.io" brand? I'm not sure if that's still the case.Steve from @sportsbet.io might know more about that.Quote from: sportsbet.io on April 10, 2020, 04:05:35 PMSteve, Sportsbet.ioesportsbet.ioI don't think esportsbet.io is related in any shape or form to sportsbet.io, and never has been.The quote you got from Steve is from 2020 amidst the start of the pandemic where the only thing you could bet was esports, hence the "sarcastic" undertone of adding esportsbet.io at the end of the message.A quick search on google shows that esportsbet.io was somewhat recently rebranded from djesports.io (never heard of those guys before).https://www.gamblingnews.com/news/dj-esports-rebrands-as-esportsbet-io-with-clear-focus-on-future/Hi guys and morvillz7zMany thanks morvillz7z >> that is exactly what happened.. we have no idea or any knowledge of this actual e-sportsbet.io site or domain >> and sportsbet.io really hope "thebloodmaster" can get this issue solved.. regards, Steve.Sportsbet.io
